content: The Buddha's teachings regarding giving food to naked ascetics can be found in the Cullavagga section of the Vinaya Pitaka, which is one of the three basket of scriptures in the Pali Canon. In the Cullavagga, the Buddha is recorded as having forbidden monks from giving food to naked ascetics who do not observe the proper codes of conduct for ascetics. The Buddha taught that such naked ascetics were not worthy of respect or support, and that monks should not associate with them.
